item.title: Flooding along Halfway Street, 4th September
item.description:
This section of the road from 271 - 277 always floods after heavy rainfall. There is a storm drain on this section which appears to be blocked.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 275, Halfway Street, Longlands, Sidcup, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Drain is blocked, 4th September
item.description:

item.title: 42 st Gabriel’s road, 4th September
item.description:
There have been terrible pot holes for a whole year now. It is a real safety issue for us cyclists. Every Friday we run a Brent funded Bike Bus to local schools, with young children on their own bikes. We need these fixed, especially the large one by 42, but there are 4 in total

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): St Gabriels Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very, very overgrown vegetation which is obstructing the footpath, 4th September
item.description:
This has been growing very quickly. The weeds have grown across the footpath and you have to push the weeds out of the way to pass through. Some of these are getting thorny and could cause injury. Weeds also are growing on the paving stones and damaging them. It is a dangerous alley way and elderly people use this. If people fall they could seriously injure themselves.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 110, Parkhill Road, Bexley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog (or human) poo on the pavement, 4th September
item.description:
This poo has been sitting in the same spot of the pavement outside our building (Boulevard Mansions 44-46 Borough Road), for almost a week now. The street is completely ignored by the council cleaning teams. I have photos of pieces of fruit rotting unmoved in the same place for months. The council needs to sort this out, street cleaning should be a basic service that we are entitled to receive in return of the council tax that is demanded of us.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 44-46, Borough Road, Elephant and Castle, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Clarendon Street, Pimlico, London

item.title: Bed and mattress leaning on post., 4th September
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 41,43, Oakdene Road, Poverest, London

item.title: Zip ties on barriers - wentworth crescent walkway, 4th September
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wentworth Crescent, Peckham, London
